page.title: 03HALEYS MANOR FARM
page.content: Hayleys Manor farm is in the southern part of our area and covers nearly 500 hectares of land.It is owned by Mr. Peter Padfield,whose relatives own many of the local farms.The land was once farmed by his parents,but they have now taken a smaller farm while Hayleys has been expanded and is run with another five local farms. Mr Padfield uses most of the land for arable farming,but a little is used for his herd of 800 pedigree dairy Friesians on which he is recognised as an expert:the week before our visit he was away in Germany judging and advising on the breed. There are three ponds outside the farmhouse,used mostly for water storage,but also to encourage water birds and keep fish.The farm has its own borehole used for farm water supply,and to top up the ponds.
